name: Clarion Inn Lake Buena Vista

reviews.text: I stayed at this large tourist class hotel during a recent business trip. My standard room with two beds was fine – clean and adequately equipped with a small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, and TV with the usual assortment of cable channels – including Showtime, not HBO. The tub and toilet are separate from the sink, making it easier for two people to get ready at the same time. Unless your children are small the room would be crowded for a family of four. Poolside rooms also face I-4 and get a fair amount of road noise; if that bothers you I suggest you request a room overlooking the parking lot. The beds were clean and comfortable – not quite up to Hilton standards, but I was not paying Hilton prices.
reviews.title: Okay, but not for business

likes.liked: — Location - 5 minutes drive to downtown Disney
likes.disliked: — No internet in room + road noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I never sampled breakfast, but it looked like the usual mix of cereal and pastries and was busy. Limited internet services can be accessed through the room TV or there is a wireless hot spot in the lobby if you bring your laptop. Not a very quiet environment to get work done in. I did not use the shuttle services. There are several restaurants within walking distance, as well as numerous others within a few minutes drive – I recommend the Tiki Bar at the Carving Station for good sandwiches. The ticket people in the hotel lobby can be pushy, which is typical in this area.
reviews.title: Comfort - but not that comfortable. Shuttle bus problems

likes.disliked: — poor shuttle bus service to theme park, no lunch served, poor luggage storage area.

reviews.text: If all you want is a clean, comfortable room in a good location for I-4 and Disney while you explore the Orlando area, this is an economical choice that will suit your family needs.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.text: This review is based on a 6 night stay.
reviews.title: No problems here

reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Would not return

reviews.text: We stayed here for a total of three nights. We arrived fairly late in the evening. When we checked in, we were advised that there were no more standard rooms (uh, hello, we made reservations!) but luckly they upgraded us to a family suite without the additional charge. The building could use more lighting. I didn't feel safe walking around outside the room. OUR DOOR DID NOT CLOSE EASILY. We had to put ALOT of force into closing our room door properly and securely... and trying to unlock the door was also a challenge. Every morning when the maid finished cleaning our room, she left the curtains wide open allowing outsiders to look into our room. Glad there was a safe inside the room. Fridge came in handy. We found a bug inside the microwave. We left a cup of orange soda on our bedside table. The morning after, we found a family of ants swimming in it. The carpet was sticky. The bedside lamp flickered. Long Long Long lines up for the free continental breakfast. Instead of waiting in line, we walked into the dining area, picked up our food, and ate it outside under the sun.
reviews.title: Unwanted bugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third stay at this hotel. While I-4 IS close that's good and bad. The rooms are clean although not spacious, but face it...you are only there to sleep most of the time anyway! The pool water was very cold, the breakfast buffet isn't great but we will stay there again. For the price you just can't beat it.
reviews.title: 3rd visit!!! will stay again!

likes.liked: — close to all theme parks - easy to get on I-4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property meets only the most minimum standards of Comfort Inns in my opinion. Over 600 rooms in several five story wings. Those unlucky enough to get even numbered rooms get to look out on busy Interstate 4 with accompying noise all night long. Choice Privilege members beware, no free newspaper. When I asked the clerk for my free paper she looked like I was from outer space. Maintence problem water soaked carpet was solved by giving us another room in another wing. Staff was friendly but overworked........
reviews.title: Stay Elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to get away for a few days and the deal we got through Spirit Airlines for airfare and this hotel made Orlando a no brainer. We paid $29 per night (you read that right, $29.) for this comfort Inn LBV and saw mixed reviews here on TA but, for 29 bucks, what the heck. We thought that if it turned out to be a dump, we'd leave and find another place, but if it was clean and suitable for our needs, we found a bargain. Our needs for three nights in Orlando include a clean room and bathroom, a comfortable bed with reasonably quiet neighbors and a safe location. Basically, all we ask is for a secure, clean locker for our stuff while we do the Disney rat race for a few days. When we arrived at 10 AM they let us check in early and and had a room ready. We went to the room and were very pleasantly surprised. All our needs were filled nicely with the bonus of a refrigerator, microwave, keyed safe and extra pillows and towels. Furthermore, the location was safe and very convenient to the Disney attractions.
reviews.title: Absolute Bargain...Almost !

reviews.text: Now, if you're reading this review because of the title, and your Orlando needs are the same as ours, you're probably waiting for the other shoe to drop, right? Well, here it is....FLEAS !! The first morning after I woke up, I noticed some flea bites around both ankles and on my legs. My wife didn't get bit, so I just thought that I got bit at Epcot, but when my wife complained of bites the second morning and I had some more, I knew it was from the room. I was so disappointed and considered not writing a review at all because I'm the kind of person that doesn't say anything if it's not nice, but i felt that i owed it to the TA community to warn you of our experience. We decided to check out and move on that evening and here's the most disturbing part... I mentioned it to the front desk clerk and she only seemed to care about charging me for the third night! I didn't ask for a refund or any compensation, I just wanted them to correct the problem for the next guest. She just made sure i knew (two or three times) that I was going to be charged for the extra night ! Furthermore, a few days after we got home, I got an email from the Comfort Inn folks asking me how I enjoyed my stay. I replied with this story and have received no reply... it's been two weeks!!!! Either they don't really read their email and don't care or they're thinking "what do you want for $29?"
reviews.title: a great place

reviews.text: We stayed here for 10 days in May - the longest and noisiest of my life. The rooms were not clean, breakfast was like a scene from jail time(palstic cutlery) the interstate practically runs through the centre of the hotel and is unrelentless, do not expect to sleep in this hotel!!! We eventually had enough and checked out a week early to stay in a dsiney resort hotel and would strongly advise you don't even attempt a visit. Cheap and nasty is this hotels motto- you have been warned!!
reviews.title: do not stay here under any circumstances!

reviews.text: Shelly....NS...Canada
reviews.title: Disney '07

reviews.text: We stayed at Comfort Inn LBV for two weeks last April and had hardly any problems at all. The room was kept clean, very honest staff(left money on the dresser a few times and it was still there when we got back) and the front desk staff was very nice. Not a luxury hotel but it definitely served the purpose. The only problem we had was the shuttles to the parks, we found they didn't come frequently enough so the second week there we ended up renting a car. We are returning to Disney in Feb'08 and will be staying at Caribbean Beach Resort at Disney this time so we will get the extra magic hours. The comfort inn is a good hotel...would stay there again!!!
reviews.title: Good Value For Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a little apprehensive about this Hotel after reading some of the reviews posted earlier in the year. However, the room was clean and tidy, there were no cockroaches(!) and we didn't notice the traffic noise from the interstate too much (although we were on the Car-Park side and this probably does make a difference).
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The major plus point is the free transportation which is a great money saver and runs at regular intervals (although it can get a little crowded during the later runs back from the Disney Parks). If you are lucky you will encounter Frederick - the friendliest Bus Driver in Florida, who is a mine of information about getting around Orlando and probably one of the nicest people you could ever hope to meet.
reviews.title: ideal hotel with good access for disney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for a week in November over the Thanksgiving holiday. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was clean and well equipped with a safe, fridge, microwave, coffee maker and a large comfy bed. We didn't stay in our room too much though due to the great location of the hotel to the Disney parks. We used the free shuttle buses on some occassions to get to the parks before opening but we also found that we were within walking distance to Downtown Disney so on a night instead of having to wait for the scheduled shuttle we would catch a free Disney bus to Downtown Disney and then walk back to our room. The hotel is located near to a wide variety of restaurants and bars and was a great price for the location to everything. The pools are a little small and located next to the busy I-4 and we did not bother with the free breakfast due to the queues for tables.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Stayed here in october this year & I was a bit wary after reading some reviews. This hotel is all that you need. The rooms are cleaned daily, the staff are very helpfull & friendly & the continental breakfast is fine. The location is also great central to all parks.If I had one complaint to make it would have been about the shuttle bus company they use the buses are on thier last legs and keep breaking down and the only driver you can rely on to be there on time is fredrick. Apart from that I had a great time & would have no problem staying there again. Not as bad as some reviews suggest.
reviews.title: All you need

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through travelzoo $39.99 with full breakfast, upgraded to King Room stayed for 10 days. Hotel was fine, everything worked, staff was nice & helpful. Full Breakfast was good, could make your own waffle station, it was hot, nice variety. There was a long line up for the continental breakfast but what do you expect for a free breakfast! Reservation staff were good, no line up upon arrival, no issues. Room could use a bit of upgrading with carpet and new bedspread, shower worked great. Didn't spend alot of time in room so worked out well for the price. Fridge was a bonus as we went to grocery store to buy snacks etc. Didn't use Microwave but nice to know it was there if we wanted to use it. Rented a car so didn't use the shuttle to the parks. It's not the Ritz so would recommend if on a budget as you don't spend alot of time in the room anyway.
reviews.title: For the price, it was fine

likes.disliked: — Carpet was old and coming away from the wall

reviews.text: Wow did I make a mistake staying here! My son and I were just passing through Orlando prior to our Carribean cruise so I thought we'd go to Disney for a few days and wanted somewhere cheap to stay. Well, this place is cheap... and dirty and over-crowded. My room was basic, not terribly clean and not comfortable. The pillows were lumpy and the heat/AC system was unpredictable. The restaurant was the worst experience of my stay. The free cold breakfast was horrific- cheap donuts, no-name cereals, poor quality in all regards and very crowded. Hoping for better we paid for the hot breakfast. It was the worst tasting food I've ever eaten. The little store is way over-priced. It was cheaper for me to buy things at Disney World than the store. The Disney World shuttle was scary. The bus was old, dirty, smelly and over-crowded. I felt like I was taking public transportation in a 3rd world country. Furthermore, the schedule for pick-up and drop-off was very limited. I would definately encourage people to bring their own car and not take this shuttle service. The best part of the hotel was the front desk staff. They allowed me to check in hours early and were always pleasant and respectful.
reviews.title: Rating Comfort Inn 2 stars is being very generous!

reviews.text: This is a good hotel for those who are value customers and only need the basic essentials. If you want mints on your pillow and fluffy towels, this is not the place for you. This is not a resort, and does not feel like a resort. My purpose in getting this hotel was price ($42 per night), free parking, free breakfast and its excellent location. I stayed 4 nights and only used it to sleep, bathe and eat breakfast. I was at the theme parks the rest of the time.
reviews.title: Good for the value customer

likes.liked: — Price, location, free parking, free breakfast
likes.disliked: — Wear and tear. Not luxury, but I expected that.

reviews.text: I stayed here a couple of years ago so things may have changed but thought I would leave my opinion as a solo female traveller.
reviews.title: Excellent valus for money hiotel

likes.liked: — Excellent value for money an good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having been invited to a wedding but having to attend on my own I was looking for budget accommodation in Orlando that was in a good location.
reviews.title: Honest review of hotel, and local attractions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After weeks of research and reading plenty of reviews I opted for the Comfort Inn Lake Buena Vista and I was very glad that I did. At the time I paid around £25 a night for a double room and for the money that I paid I was very impressed.
reviews.title: well situated

reviews.text: The hotel itself is basic and the restaurant really is not worth a visit although for a quick and basic breakfast that's included in the price then it's fine. The hotel did have two pools though which always seemed clean and were never actually that busy as everyone was obviously at the parks. My room was a good size with a huge double bed in it and although a little tired looking was more than adequate, plus the maid came in everyday.
reviews.title: Not up to par

reviews.text: Aside from the price I chose the hotel for location. It must be one of the few in Orlando where you can actually walk to places. There were plenty of restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk of the hotel plus a number of convenience stores. In addition you could also walk to down town Disney in about 20 minutes which made a nice change from relying on taxis.
reviews.title: Convenient yes, pleasent No!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my first time writing a hotel review, because i havnt felt the need to before. I booked it via my local AAA-who had said they heard bad stuff at the hojo's, but hadnt about this hotel (trying to geta not expensive hotel for us). Me and my wife arrived at 1 am to check in. The signs said not to park up by the check in drive thru area, so we parked and went in. Inside we went up to a lady at the counter. She informed us breakfast was until 1030. She then told us our room (5th floor which when outside the room you see the pool below). She then made a nice big circle for the elevators for us to take to get to the room. So..we arrived at the elevators. Elevator 1- read a sign "out of order". We looked at elevator 2 right next to it-it read "out of order." We ended up looking around the hotel for another elevator-and found one at the end of the hotel building that worked. Why couldnt the front desk have told us that? As for the room, the toilet ran all night and wouldnt flush, the sink faucet had a messed up handle that you couldnt control what temperature the water would come out at, and at some points whether the water would even stop comin out of the faucet. We called the 2nd night at 11 pm to fix these (we went straight to be dthe 1st night, and was out all day until 11 the next day). The people we called COULD NOT speak good english! when i was trying to explain the toilet was running, they thought i was trying to tell them i wanted a wake up call!. I did get them straightened out before i hung up the phone. They said the would have someone up right away. An hour later i called again and again they said they would have someone right up. After the 2nd call someone came up about 10 minutes later who couldnt speak good english and fixed them.
reviews.title: Would not stay there again

reviews.text: This makes it obvious that they dont inspect their rooms before giving them to customers..
reviews.title: Good value and good location.

reviews.text: Another bad note about the hotel is that there is a vent in teh bathroom, but no fan switch anywhere. This is goin to lead to mold forming.
reviews.title: Good enough for what is needed

reviews.text: A final note is that the last night of our stay, the towels in our room were dirty.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay here again

likes.disliked: — traffic noise and dirty rooms with broken items

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review maybe a bit late but having been to florida three times now and stayed at different hotels each time i feel i can give my review.This hotel is quite basic ,the rooms were spacious quite clean but could be better.The pool area was great, kept very clean and they provided towels every day and it stayed open until ten every night which was excellent especially after a very hot day .The breakfast which was free was very good as much as you can eat ,fresh fruit occasionally, cerals,toast,tea coffee etc.You could also pay for a cooked breakfast if you wanted and also in the evening it also served hot food ,this was not so good ,but it might have changed since i went.The bar was great and so were the barmen you got free popcorn with your beer and the bar also served snacks the pizza was excellent.The location was good and right next door was a small shopping complex with a couple of resturants.Just down the road past the shops are more resturants and if you carry on to the highway and turn left there is a sizzler which serves all you can eat buffet for about $8.99 very good value. Have there chicken noodle soup it is delicious.You will also see lots of other stores along the road especially if when you come out of vineland avenue and turn right, you will come across the crossroads shopping complex and other stores.We went on one trip and that was to clearwater beach go if you can it is stunning and put on lots of suncream.When we walked about, we felt quite safe and we did walk from downtown disney back to the hotel one day during the day it took us about 40 mins, we don't drive so we got about on foot or the occasional taxi. From the hotel you can see the outlet stores like nike ,addias,levi etc but that is across the I-4 so a taxi is a must cost us for 6 people about $11 lots of great shopping and the shops are open until 11 o'clock. If you do decide on this hotel request a room away from the interstate because it is noisy the traffic are non stop night and day.Florida is a great place and lovely people the parks fantastic even for older people ,my dad came, he was 70 and he loved evey minute and all my children are adults so you don't have to be young to enjoy disney. This hotel was ok for our first visit would i stay here again probably not.
reviews.title: Just average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Comfort Inn LBV Feb.25-March 4 and after reading some of the comments we were a little concerned. No need to be!!!!
reviews.title: More than I hoped for!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were very basic, but cleaned every day. It is located in a great spot..very close to entertainment and resturants.
reviews.title: Price is right for this 'resort'...this is a good find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not do the Disney theme parks so cannot comment on that, but we did go to many atttractions including a hot air balloon ride with Thompson Aire. If you are interested in that go see the lady in the lobby and she will book it for you. They picked us up at 5:30am and took us to the launch site. It was AWESOME. We got to see the sunrise over disney. Amazing. Jeff, our captain was very informative and told many jokes. We toasted our flight with a glass of champainge mmmm!!!!
reviews.title: Good for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can call the resort in advance do so and book the 5th floor in building 4000. You are able to watch the disney fireworks every night at 9:00pm. They are not very long but still quite nice.
reviews.title: Pet friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have a great trip and don't sweat the small stuff. This hotel has everything you need..just not in a fancy way!!!
reviews.title: Perfectly fine stay

reviews.text: This was the worst stay ever and to top it off they charged us twice for it! They said (after transferring me 5 fimes) that it was impossible for their system to charge us twice so now we're having the credit card company deal with it. The rooms were in horrible shape with stains on the bedspreads and broken appliances. Our trash would be left for several days and once the maid must have shut the door so hard that it triggered the latch and Security took a half hour to break into the room so we could retire after a day at Disney. There was one morning that the eggs on the hot buffet line tasted like someone had ashed in them. I would recommend this place to anyone, ever!
reviews.title: I am so livid! Worst place EVER.

reviews.text: Our family of five stayed one night at this hotel. We really appreciated the kid's suite. Our three kids were partitioned from the adults. The room itself was a bit dirty and worn but nothing terrible. If it was me, I would have vacuumed better if I knew guests were coming over. What I really didn't like was that you had to pay for Internet access. In this day in age, that should be included. Like a room having a TV or phone or...toilet! It was a very good location. Didn't take advantage of the breakfast. Way too crowded. But all in all, our stay wasn't bad. But there are better places to stay in the area.
reviews.title: Okay for one night.

likes.disliked: — no Internet access without paying and lack of cleanliness

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at this Comfort Inn wasn't tainted by any one major problem, but by a long list of small issues that added up:
reviews.title: We won't be going back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Upon arrival, our sink was clogged and full of water.
reviews.title: Great staff and location

reviews.text: 2. We were told that the handyman to fix the sink was "on-site" and "on the way". He didn't arrive for 45 minutes (holding up our dinner plans).
reviews.title: near to theme parks

aka: Clarion Inn Lake Buena Vista Hotel Orlando
